info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 11:48PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Union County in Piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM EST, Stream gauges across Union County in North Carolina continue to show elevated levels. Minor flooding continues and will likely persist into the early morning hours, especially as additional light rain showers move through the region. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Monroe, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Waxhaw, Marshville, Lake Park, Mineral Springs, Hemby Bridge, Marvin, Fairview In Union County, Sturdivants, Jaars and Trinity. - Flooding is most likely along Bearskin Creek at North Charlotte Avenue near Monroe, near the Rocky River in the northern end of the county, and possibly along Goose Creek at Mill Grove Road near Indian Trail. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
